attributes.comment:
My wife Norma and I live next door to a couple with one child, attempting to adopt a
baby from Guatemala. The international adoption process is very high for these
exemplary neighbors. Now it appears they may be faced with proposed increases of
about $600 for I-600A/1-600 and about $400 for N-600, and the Certificate of
Citizenship for IR-4 children. We feel that adopting a baby is different from foreigners
applying for citizenship, especially in these times of illegal immigration. At least babies
do not present time and money consuming investigations into political backgrounds,
and they'll grow up with taxpaying parents who are already on record as good citizens.
For these reasons we appeal to you for exempting the adoption of babies from the
above mentioned fee increases.
Thank you for your consideration.Sincerely, Cornelis and Norma Janse-Kok
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Cornelis C. Janse-Kok
